name: service-account-group-info
notes: It is recommended to further verify whether these service accounts have weak passwords or improper permission configurations in the system.

name: vsftpd-configuration
description: The vsftpd configuration file indicates that the FTP service has local user login enabled (chroot_local_user=YES), but no hardcoded credentials were found. The maximum client limit is set to 2 (max_clients=2).
notes: The FTP service configuration is relatively secure, but it is still recommended to check the strength of the actual account passwords in use.

name: ushare-configuration
description: The uShare DLNA service configuration indicates that Xbox 360 compatibility mode (USHARE_ENABLE_XBOX=yes) and DLNA profile support (USHARE_ENABLE_DLNA=yes) are enabled, but no hardcoded credentials were found.
notes: No significant security issues were detected in the DLNA service configuration, but it is recommended to check whether the service version has any known vulnerabilities.

name: samba-empty-directory
description: The target directory 'etc/samba' was found to be empty, containing no files that could potentially hold hardcoded credentials or sensitive information. This includes both regular and hidden files.
notes: No Samba configuration files were found in the firmware image. This may indicate that the Samba service is either not enabled or not configured in this firmware version.

name: hardcoded-3g-passwords
description: Multiple hardcoded 3G connection credentials were discovered in the web/js/3g.js file. These credentials appear to be default passwords used by multiple mobile operators worldwide. The passwords are stored in plaintext and could potentially be exploited for unauthorized access to 3G network connections.
notes: hardcoded_credential

name: httpd-base64-implementation
description: The discovery of Base64 encoding-related function references (b64_encode) and the Base64 character table indicates that the system may use Base64 encoding to transmit sensitive data under certain circumstances.
notes: Further analysis is needed on the usage scenarios of the b64_encode function.

name: httpd-REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER-interface-info
description: Hardcoded administrative interface path (/frame/login.htm) and default administrator REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER (REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER) were detected, which may pose security risks.
notes: This information may be used for brute-force attacks

name: httpd-basic-auth-implementation
description: The presence of HTTP header fields related to authentication (Authorization: Basic) and the definition of an authentication realm indicate the use of HTTP Basic Authentication.
notes: HTTP Basic Authentication transmits credentials in Base64 encoding, making them vulnerable to interception and decoding.

name: rcS-init-script-scan
description: No hardcoded credentials or sensitive information were found in the `etc/init.d/rcS` file. The file primarily contains system initialization scripts, including operations such as directory creation, kernel module loading, and network configuration.
notes: Although no direct evidence was found, the `telnetd` command in the file may indicate that the system has enabled an insecure telnet service. It is recommended to further examine the telnet configuration.

name: dev-directory-scan
description: A comprehensive scan of the dev directory and all its subdirectories (net, pts, shm) has been completed. All inspected directories were empty, with no files or hardcoded credentials and sensitive information found.
notes: No hardcoded credentials or sensitive information were found in the target dev directory.
